https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001169 (Broad palm)  ; abnormality of limbs

value.value: For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.
Pro děti od narození do 4 let věku šířka dlaně větší než 2 SD; pro děti od 4 do 16 let šířka dlaně nad 95. percentilem; nebo očividně disproporční šířka dlaně k délku

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.

value.value: Çocuklarda doğumdan 4 yaşına kadar avuç genişliğinin ortalamanın 2 SD üzerinde olmasıdır; 4 yaşından 16 yaşında kadar avuç genişliğinin 95. yüzdelik dilimin üzerinde olmasıdır; veya avuç genişliğinin uzunluğuna göre orantısız olarak görünmesi

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.

definition.value: Hand width is measured across the palm at the level of the MCPJ (radial aspect of the second MCPJ to the ulnar aspect of the fifth MCPJ) [Hall et al., 2007]. Caution is advised with the subjective assessment as short metacarpals can mimic a broad palm. In persons with polydactyly that includes a supernumerary metacarpal, that should be separately coded and the measurement technique from Hall et al, [2007] would need to be modified to account for the supernumerary digit (i.e., with postaxial polydactyly, measure to the sixth MCPJ).

A condition in which middle parts of the hand (fingers and metacarpals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middle fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.

Stav, kdy chybí střední části ruky (prsty na ruce a metakarlální kosti), což vypadá jako rozštěp. Závažnost je velmi variabilní od mírně hypoplastických středních prstů přes chybění středních prstů nebo až oligo- nebo monodaktylické ruce.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A condition in which middle parts of the hand (fingers and metacarpals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middle fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A condition in which middle parts of the hand (fingers and metacarpals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middle fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.

label of HP:0001177 (Preaxial hand polydactyly)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: Elin radiyal kısmında yerleşmiş fazladan parmak. Baş parmağı içeren polidaktili (fazla parmak) yüksek değişkenlik ve ciddiyette bir çok farklı formda meydana gelebilir. Etli yumrudan, kısmi duplikasyon/ayrılmadan tam duplike veya hatta triplike baş parmağına veya preaksiyel (elin raiyal kısmı) fazla parmağa kadar değişkenlik gösterir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.

value.value: Nadpočetné prsty umístněné na radiální, tj. palcové straně ruky. Polydaktylie zahrnující palec jsou vysoce variabilní a různě závažné. Projevy se pohybují na spektru od drobných masitých výrůstků přes komplexní či parciální duplikaci, někdy dokonce triplikaci palce či prstů

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.

value.value: Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001178 (Ulnar claw)  ; abnormality of limbs

value.value: Abnormální držení ruky charakterizované hyperextenzí v metakarpofalangeálním kloubu čtvrtého a pátého prstu a flexí v interfalangeálním kloubu té samé ruky, takže konečky čtvrtého a pátého prstu směrují do dlaně. Nacházíme při obrně nervus ulnaris

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.

value.value: An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.

Avuç içine doğru kıvrılmış gibi olan dördüncü ve beşinci parmakların metakarpofalangeyal eklemlerde hiperekstansiyonu ve aynı parmakların interfalangeyal eklemlerinin fleksiyonu ile karakterize anormal bir el pozisyonudur

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.

definition.value: An ulnar claw, also known as claw hand, is an abnormal hand position that is associated with lesions of the ulnar nerve. Note that ulnar claw is to be distinguished from ectrodactyly, which also can be referred to as claw hand.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.

value.value: In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.

definition.value: The thumb is both flexed and adducted. Lesser degrees of adduction than that specified here may warrant the use of this term, for example, when the tip of the thumb lies near the base of F2 or F3.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001188 (Hand clenching)  ; abnormality of limbs

value.value: Abnormální držení rukou - ruce jsou sevřené v pěst. Všechny prsty jsou kompletně flektovány v metakarpofalangeálních a interfalangeálníchh klubech

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints. In prenatal sonography of the fetal clenched hand, the index finger overlaps a clenched fist formed by the other digits. The proximal interphalangeal articulation of the index finger is flexed and ulnarly deviated, and the thumb is adducted.

value.value: An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints. In prenatal sonography of the fetal clenched hand, the index finger overlaps a clenched fist formed by the other digits. The proximal interphalangeal articulation of the index finger is flexed and ulnarly deviated, and the thumb is adducted.
Ellerin yumruğa doğru kapandığı anormal bir el postürüdür. Bütün parmaklar tamamen metakarpofalangeyal ve interfalangeyal eklemlerde kıvrılmıştır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints. In prenatal sonography of the fetal clenched hand, the index finger overlaps a clenched fist formed by the other digits. The proximal interphalangeal articulation of the index finger is flexed and ulnarly deviated, and the thumb is adducted.

definition.value: Hand clenching is commonly characterized by malpositioning of the fingers characterized by radial deviation of the 4th and 5th digits and ulnar deviation of the 2nd digit over the 3rd finger. Hand clenching is distinguished from Camptodactyly, as that term may describe fewer than five digits of a eudactylous hand and does not involve the MCPJ. The digits may overlap when they lie flexed in the palm. It is not necessary to specify the overlapping fingers finding separately.

A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.
Palec se třemi falangy v proximo-distální ose. Tento výraz se tedy použije, pokud má palec akcesorní phalanx, čímž upomíná zbylé prsty

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.

value.value: Tek, proksimo-distal aksta üç falankslı baş parmak. Bu nedenle, bu terim baş parmağın parmak benzeri görünmesine yol açan baş parmağın fazladan falanksa sahip olduğu durumda kullanılır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.

definition.value: The requirement for a single PD axis relates to the issue that partial forms of Preaxial polydactyly may comprise a partially duplicated thumb with two distal phalanges and a single proximal phalanx. That finding is instead coded as a mild form of thumb polydactyly. Note that this finding can be readily assessed by examination and/or physical manipulation of the thumb.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001204 (Distal symphalangism of hands)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: 遠位指趾関節癒合症 (手)

Distal simfalangizm terimi el parmaklarının distal ve orta falankslarının kemiksi füzyonuna denir, diğer bir deyişle röntgende görülebilen distal interfalangeyal eklem (DIE) eksikliği veya distal interfalangeyal parmak çizgilerinin yokluğu

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.

value.value: Pojem distální symfalangismus značí kostní fúzi distálních a středních falangů prstů ruky, jinými slovy chybí distální interfalangeální kloub (DIP), jeho absence je zřejmá ze zobrazovacích metod a z absenci distálních interfalangeálních kožních rýh

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.

value.value: The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001212 (Prominent fingertip pads)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the skeletal system

value.value: "Parmak uçlarının ventral taraflarında yumuşak doku belirginliği. ""Kalıcı fetal parmak ucu yastıkçıkları"" sıklıkla eş anlamlı kullanılmaktadır, fakat genellikle var olmayan hasta hikayesi bilgisine işaret ettiğinden kullanılmaması tercih edilir"

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: "A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips. The term ""persistent fetal fingertip pads"" is often used as a synonym, but should better not be used because it implies knowledge of history of the patient which often does not exist."

value.value: "Všeobecně známé jako ""fetal finger pads"", výraz značí perzistenci fetálních ventrálně prominujících polštářků na konečcích prstů. Užívání tohoto výrazu je však ne zcela správné, protože implikuje znalost anamnézy pacient, která často neexistuje (perzistují polštářky od fetálního období?)"

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: "A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips. The term ""persistent fetal fingertip pads"" is often used as a synonym, but should better not be used because it implies knowledge of history of the patient which often does not exist."

value.value: A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips. The term "persistent fetal fingertip pads" is often used as a synonym, but should better not be used because it implies knowledge of history of the patient which often does not exist.

value.value: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second to fifth fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.

definition.value: The condition known as "hitchhiker's thumb" means, that the distal phalanx of the thumb, when the thumb is extended (as in a "thumbs-up"), can extend backwards toward the nail and outwards at an angle of up to, or more than, 90 degrees from the thumb, whereas normally it will extend straight out with little backward bending.

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.

value.value: Nedostatečný rozvoj thenarového valu se zmenšením objemu tkáně dlaně v oblasti baze palce

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.

value.value: Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.

definition.value: The reduced soft tissue is typically abductor pollicis brevis and flexor pollicis brevis muscle bulk. Detection of this abnormality entails clinical judgment, especially in mild cases. The bulk of the muscle mass around the base of the thumb is diminished, and there may be a mild concavity over the volar aspect of the first metacarpal. When the deficiency is unilateral, comparison between the two hands will point up the often-subtle change in contour of the thenar muscles. If the degree of involvement is severe, the palm may taper in width proximally.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001249 (Intellectual disability)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Gelişimsel dönem esnasında köken alan normalin altında entellektüel fonsiyon. Entellektüel yetersizlik, önceden zeka geriliği olarak anılıyordu, IQ skorlarının 70'in altında olması olarak tanımlanmaktadır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, is characterized by subnormal intellectual functioning that occurs during the developmental period. It is defined by an IQ score below 70.

definition.value: Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, is characterized by subnormal intellectual functioning that occurs during the developmental period. It is defined by an IQ score below 70.

value.value: Subnormální kognitivní funkce, která vznikla během vývojového období. Intelektová nedostatečnost, dříve označovaná jako mentální retardace je definována jako IQ skóre pod 70

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, is characterized by subnormal intellectual functioning that occurs during the developmental period. It is defined by an IQ score below 70.

definition.value: This term should be used for children who are at least five years old. For younger children, consider using the term Global developmental delay (HP:0001263).

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001250 (Seizures)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: A seizure is an intermittent abnormality of nervous system physiology characterized by a transient occurrence of signs and/or symptoms due to abnormal excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.

Křeče (epileptické křeče, epileptický záchvat) jsou přechodnou abnormalitou centrální nervové soustavy způsobenou anormálními výboji mozkových neuronů klinicky charakterizovanou kombinacemi poruch čití, ztráty vědomí, postižení psychických funkcí či křečovitých pohybů. Termín epilepsie se používá k popisu chronických, rekurentních záchvatů

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A seizure is an intermittent abnormality of nervous system physiology characterized by a transient occurrence of signs and/or symptoms due to abnormal excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.

value.value: Nöbetler ani, aşırı, hastalık düzeyindeki serebral nöronların boşalımı nedeniyle oluşan klinik olarak his bozukluğu, bilinç kaybı, fiziksel fonksiyon bozukluğu veya konvulzif hareketler kombinasyonu ile karakterize merkezi sinir sisteminin aralar ile gerçekleşen anormalliğidir. Epilepsi terimi kronik, tekrar eden nöbetleri tanımlamak için kullanılmaktadır

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A seizure is an intermittent abnormality of nervous system physiology characterized by a transient occurrence of signs and/or symptoms due to abnormal excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.

definition.value: A type of electrographic seizure has been proposed in neonates which does not have a clinical correlate, it is electrographic only. The term epilepsy is not used to describe recurrent febrile seizures. Epilepsy presumably reflects an abnormally reduced seizure threshold.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001251 (Ataxia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- or overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).

Cerebelární ataxie je ataxie způsobená dysfunkcí mozečku. Tato způsobuje rozličné neurologické defekte jako asynergie (ztráta koordinace mezi svaly, končetinami a klouby), dysmetrie (ztráta schopnosti posoudit vzdálenost - nedotažení či přestřelení pohybu při pokusu uchopit předmět), dysdiadochokineze (neschopnost opakovaně provádět rychlé pohyby vyžadující zapojení antagonistických svalových skupin)

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- or overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).

value.value: Serebellar ataksi beyincik disfonksiyonu nedenli olan ataksiye denir. Bu asinerji (kaslar, üyeler ve eklemler arasında koordinasyon eksikliği), dismetri (yakalama hareketlerinde fazla veya az pas geçmeye neden olan mesafe muhakemesinde eksiklik) ve disdiadokinezi (tekrarlayan şekilde birbirine antagonize eden kas gruplarını açıp kapamayı gerektiren hızlı hareketleri sergilemede yetersizlik) gibi bir dizi temel nörolojik eksikliğe neden olur

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- or overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).

definition.value: Ataxia can be differentiated into dyssynergy, asynergy, dysmetria (hypometria, hypermetria), dysdiadochokinesis, gait ataxia, truncal ataxia, limb ataxia, and dysarthria). Note: This term does not include sensory ataxia.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001252 (Muscular hypotonia)  ; abnormality of the musculature

value.value: Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist.

Kas hipotonisi, sıklıkla azalmış kas gücü de dahil olan anormal olarak düşük kas tonusudur (kasta hareket için gerilim veya direnç miktarı). Hipotoni pasif gerilmeye karşı azalmış direnç ile karakterizedir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist.

value.value: Svalová hypotonie je abnormálně nízký svalový tonus (míra napětí nebo rezistence vůči pohybu svalu). I v klidovém stavu je přítomna mírná trvalá pasivní kontrakce svalu, která klade určitý odpor pasivnímu protahování. Hypotonie je charakterizována sníženou odolností vůči pasivnímu protažení. Hypotonie není totéž co svalová slabost, i když oba stavy mohou existovat současně

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist.

definition.value: Hypotonia can be caused by abnormalities of the central nervous system, any element of the motor unit (including the lower motoneuron), or both. Hypotonia is not a specific diagnosis, but can be observed in hundreds of genetic and other diseases. The first distinction to make when assessing a child with hypotonia is whether decreased muscle tone is a result of an abnormality of the central nervous system (CNS), peripheral neuromuscular system, or a combined abnormality involving both. Clinical findings suggestive of an abnormality of the CNS may include hyperreflexia, cognitive developmental delay, and seizures. In contrast, physical findings pointing towards a neuromuscular origin may include weakness, lack of antigravity movements, muscle atrophy, fasciculations, and/or diminished reflexes, most often in the context of normal cognitive function. The HPO term does not distinguish between these etiologies. Additional HPO terms should be used as required to describe associated features.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001254 (Lethargy)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

definition.value: A state of fatigue, either physical or mental slowness and sluggishness, with difficulties in initiating or performing simple tasks. Distinguished from apathy which implies indifference and a lack of desire or interest in the task. A person with lethargy may have the desire, but not the energy to engage in personal or socially relevant tasks.

value.value: Basit eylemleri yerine getirmede veya konsantre olmada güçlük ile sonuçlanan ilgisizlik, uyuşukluk ve aldırmazlık hali

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A state of fatigue, either physical or mental slowness and sluggishness, with difficulties in initiating or performing simple tasks. Distinguished from apathy which implies indifference and a lack of desire or interest in the task. A person with lethargy may have the desire, but not the energy to engage in personal or socially relevant tasks.

value.value: Stav nezájmu, netečnosti a lhostejnosti vedoucí k neschopnosti provádět jednoduché úkoly

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: A state of fatigue, either physical or mental slowness and sluggishness, with difficulties in initiating or performing simple tasks. Distinguished from apathy which implies indifference and a lack of desire or interest in the task. A person with lethargy may have the desire, but not the energy to engage in personal or socially relevant tasks.

definition.value: Apathy and lethargy may co-occur.

Artmış kas tonusu, abartılı (aşırı uyarılabilir) tendon refleksleri ile birlikte tonik gerilme reflekslerinde hız bağımlı bir artış ile karakterize bir motor hastalık

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: The complete absence of wakefulness and consciousness, which is evident through a lack of response to any form of external stimuli.

value.value: The complete absence of wakefulness and consciousness, which is evident through a lack of response to any form of external stimuli.

definition.value: Coma is generally a result of diffuse or extensive involvement of both hemispheres of the brain or lesions in the brainstem.

https://w3id.org/babelon/comment.value: label of HP:0001260 (Dysarthria)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

value.value: Disartrik konuşma, kötü telafuz ile karakterize bir nörolojik konuşma hastalığına işaret eden genel bir tanımdır. Dahil olan nörolojik yapılara bağlı olarak, disartri spastik, gevşek, ataksik ve hipokinetik veya karışık olarak sınıflandırılabilir

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.

value.value: Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.

Dysartrická řeč je všeobecný popis označující neurologickou poruchu řeči charakterizovanou špatnou artikulací. V závislosti na příslušné neurologické struktuře může být dysartrie dále klasifikována jako spastická, chabá, ataktická, hyperkinetická a hypokinetická nebo smíšená

https://w3id.org/babelon/source_value.value: Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.
